doctor_notes: Patient presents with persistent headache, dizziness, and fatigue for the past 3 days. Blood pressure elevated at 150/95. Diagnosis: Hypertension Stage 1. Prescribed Lisinopril 10mg daily. Lifestyle modifications recommended. Follow-up in 2 weeks for BP monitoring.

Chief complaint: Severe sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and fever (101.5Â°F) for 2 days. Physical exam reveals swollen tonsils with white patches. Rapid strep test positive. Diagnosis: Streptococcal pharyngitis. Prescribed Amoxicillin 500mg TID for 10 days. Rest and increased fluid intake advised. Return if symptoms worsen.

Patient complains of joint pain in both knees, morning stiffness lasting over 30 minutes, and mild swelling. Symptoms ongoing for 6 months. X-ray shows joint space narrowing. Diagnosis: Osteoarthritis, bilateral knees. Prescribed Naproxen 500mg BID and physical therapy referral. Weight loss encouraged. Follow-up in 6 weeks.

Patient reports persistent cough with yellow sputum, shortness of breath, and low-grade fever for 1 week. Lung auscultation reveals crackles in right lower lobe. Chest X-ray shows consolidation. Diagnosis: Community-acquired pneumonia. Prescribed Azithromycin 500mg day 1, then 250mg for 4 days. Rest and hydration recommended. Follow-up in 5-7 days or sooner if worsening.

Complaint of burning sensation during urination, increased frequency, and lower abdominal discomfort for 3 days. Urinalysis positive for nitrites and leukocytes. Diagnosis: Urinary tract infection. Prescribed Ciprofloxacin 500mg BID for 7 days. Increase water intake. Follow-up if symptoms persist after completing antibiotics.
